contentrichtext.text: In [[telecommunication]], a '''spill-forward feature''' is a [[service feature]], in the operation of an intermediate office, that, acting on incoming [[trunking|trunk]] service treatment indications, assumes [[routing]] control of the [[telephone call|call]] from the originating office. This increases the chances of completion by offering the call to more trunk groups than are available in the originating office. ==References== *{{FS1037C MS188}} [[Category:Teletraffic]] {{telecomm-stub}}
